ELEMENT.HTML:
zboxhead
This is the zbox_body class. Around this div and the zboxhead div is a div with zbox on it. ( Linked )

ztable_head ztable_head ztable_head
ztablerow and ztablerow0 ztable_row_small ( Linked ) ztable_row_title
ztablerow and ztablerow1 ztable_row_small ( Linked ) ztable_row_title
ztablerow and ztablerow0 ztablerow and ztablerow0 ztablerow and ztablerow0
ztablerow ztablerow ztablerow

Ztitle - used for titles on the page, not necessarily the TITLE element.
Ztitle2 - used for secondary titles and headers.
zwarn - alert text used on cart and checkout pages to display errors.
zhint - smaller text used on cart and checkout pages to display hints.
zsmall - this class will be used on the footer, but is not limited to that use.
This is zlink and this is a link with no class - these two should match
ztxt - the div around the text class divs is zborder, ztxt, AND zbody. Zborder should always ONLY be a border and zbody should always only be a background color. The Link Color (zlink class) should be visible here. The background color of zbody should always look good behind the text classes above. zbody is the CONTENT background color, not the page background color.

This is an H1. usually used for the TITLE ELEMENT

This is an H2. The custom wiki snippet puts title1 into an H2

This is an H3. The custom wiki snippet puts title2 into an H3

This is an H4.

This is an H5.
This is an H6.

"); %> <% print(""); element(TYPE=>"SITEBUTTON",BUTTON=>"paypal"); print(); print("
"); %>
%title1%this is the title one in wiki %/title1%
%title2%this is the title two in wiki %/title2%
%title3%this is the title three in wiki %/title3% inside a ztxt class
This is a wiki table.
%table% %tablerow% %tablehead%Header content%/tablehead% %tablehead%Column 2%/tablehead% %/tablerow% %tablerow% %tabledata%r1c1 content%/tabledata% %tabledata%r1c2 content%/tabledata% %/tablerow% %tablerow% %tabledata%r1c1 content%/tabledata% %tabledata%r1c2 content%/tabledata% %/tablerow% %/table%
zcolor - bgcolor shade between the light and dark with a text color specified as well.
zcolor_dark - the darkest of the three bgcolors with a text color specified as well.
zcolor_light
zcolor_contrast - a high contrast color from the other three zcolor classes and a text color.
ztab0 (off) This is the ztabbody class. ( Linked )



Warning! - The warning word to the left should be legible here.
Notice the stroke around the ztab1 class. That's zborder. It goes across the top of this cell too. It is used in this style for one page checkout.
ztab0 (off)
ztab1 (on)
ztab0 (off)
ztab0 (off)
Some Common Uses:

<% print("
"); loadurp("CSS::zcolor.bgcolor"); set($zcolor_bgcolor=>$_); set($image_loc=>"stock/layouts/p20060923/head_description"); image(src=>$image_loc,library=>"proshop",h=>"22",w=>"86",p=>"1",bg=>$zcolor_bgcolor,tag=>"1"); print(); %>

This is use for product layout p-20060923.

dividentur, et populus populum superabit, et maior serviet minori. Itaque cum populus seu gens Iudaeorum anterior sit tempore et maior per gratiam primae dignationis in lege, noster vero minor.

SKU: PROD_NAME

This is a div with zcolor contrast OUTSIDE the 600 pixel container. Used to easily determine the width around the BODY element. No style on this div.
